meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Donna Hesson Jonathan Couser Ben Ingram Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6646.

td.p: Donna Hesson, a public-health informationist from Ellicott City, Maryland
Jonathan Couser, a medieval historian from Lee, New Hampshire
Ben Ingram, an IT consultant originally from Florence, South Carolina (whose 5-day cash winnings total $115,632)

tr.td: "UP" WORDS
(Alex: Those two letters at the beginning of each correct response.)
COLLEGE FOOTBALL HALL OF FAMERS' SCHOOLS
LANDS NAMED AFTER PEOPLE
THE ARTS
DOD ABCS
(Alex: Department of Defense.)
RANDOM HOUSE DEFINES IT AS...

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'The Supreme Court case Jones v. Van Zandt didn\'t overturn the Fugitive Slave Act but did this opposite')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Ben
Jonathan
Donna
(lock game)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Ben] Another $100? I\'ve had you up to here, Ben. You know what I\'m saying? $22,100. And congratulations now on a six-day total of $137,732. Wow.)
DonnaWhat is the DAR
$1,000
JonathanWhat is the Daughters of the American Revolution
$600
BenWhat is the DAR?
$100
the Daughters of the American Revolution (DAR)')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Tracing her family to William Hood of 18th century Pennsylvania, Karen Batchelor made news as this organization\'s first African-American member')

tr.td: AFRICAN-AMERICAN FIRSTS
Tracing her family to William Hood of 18th century Pennsylvania, Karen Batchelor made news as this organization's first African-American member
Ben
Jonathan
Donna
6-day champion: $137,732
2nd place: $2,000
3rd place: $1,000
Ben
Jonathan
Donna

29 R
(including 2 DDs),
1 W
(including 1 DD)

3 R,
2 W
